ðŸš€ reddit-tui | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Browsing Reddit from the command line
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Subreddit browsing â€¢ Post viewing with comments â€¢ Keyboard navigation (vim/standard) â€¢ Configuration file support (caching, subreddit filters) â€¢ Post link opening in browser
ðŸ“– Summary: Reddittui is a terminal application for browsing Reddit using keyboard navigation. It supports viewing posts and comments, offers configuration options for caching and filtering, and allows opening post links in a web browser. The application uses the bubbletea framework and provides various keyboard shortcuts for navigation and actions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ LLMDog | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Prepare files for LLM consumption by selecting files and directories, generating a Markdown report of their structure and contents, and copying the output to the clipboard.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Interactive TUI for file navigation â€¢ Recursive file and directory selection â€¢ Gitignore support â€¢ Markdown output generation â€¢ Clipboard integration
ðŸ“– Summary: LLMDog is a command-line tool that helps prepare files for large language models. It features an interactive terminal UI for easy file selection, supports recursive selection and .gitignore rules, and outputs a well-formatted Markdown report copied to the clipboard. This streamlines the process of providing files to LLMs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Notemod | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Note-taking application
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Easy Note-Taking â€¢ Creating Tasks â€¢ Rich Text Editor â€¢ Localstorage Data Saving â€¢ Export/Import Features
ðŸ“– Summary: Notemod is an open-source note-taking app that allows users to create and manage notes with rich text formatting, tasks, and local data storage. It supports offline access and offers export/import functionality for data management. The application is designed for ease of use and accessibility.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ steam-miniprofile | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Embedding a Steam miniprofile on a website
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Loads Steam miniprofile with animated background and frame as an HTML entity â€¢ Supports multiple languages via query parameter 'lang' â€¢ Displays featured game with playtime using query parameter 'appId' â€¢ Allows interactive miniprofile with click to open Steam profile using parameters 'interactive' and 'vanityId'
ðŸ“– Summary: This tool embeds a user's public Steam miniprofile onto a website. It supports various languages, featured games, and interactive elements, all without needing an API key. The miniprofile is loaded as an HTML entity and can be customized with CSS.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ WebRover | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: AI-powered web agent for autonomous browsing, task automation, and deep research
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Three specialized agents (Task, Research, Deep Research) with dynamic selection based on task complexity â€¢ Real-time agent state visualization and streaming actions/thoughts â€¢ Local browser instance for privacy and control, multi-tab management, PDF handling, secure sessions
ðŸ“– Summary: WebRover is an AI agent combining autonomous web browsing with advanced research capabilities. It features three specialized agents for various tasks, a modern chat interface, and tools for deep research including academic paper generation. The system uses cutting-edge LLMs and browser automation for reliable and efficient web interaction.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ audiobook-creator | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Audiobook generation from various text formats (EPUB, PDF, etc.) using NLP, LLMs, and TTS technologies.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ M4B Audiobook Creation â€¢ Multi-Format Input Support (EPUB, PDF, etc.) â€¢ Multi-Format Output Support (AAC, M4A, MP3, WAV, OPUS, FLAC, PCM, M4B) â€¢ Text Cleaning â€¢ Character Identification (Gender, Age)
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides tools to convert text books into audiobooks. It supports multiple input and output formats, offers single and multi-voice narration options, and uses NLP for character identification and metadata generation. The generated audiobooks are in M4B format, including cover and chapter timestamps.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ DeeperSeek | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Using the DeepSeek website as an alternative API to the DeepSeek paid API
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automates message sending and response retrieval in DeepSeek â€¢ Supports login via token or email/password authentication â€¢ Allows regenerating responses â€¢ Enables session management (reset chat, log out, retrieve token) â€¢ Supports bypassing Cloudflare protection
ðŸ“– Summary: DeeperSeek is a Python library that automates interactions with the DeepSeek website. It supports various authentication methods, session management, and advanced features like bypassing Cloudflare and using proxies, all while providing detailed logging. This allows users to interact with DeepSeek without needing the paid API.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ bananas | Svelte
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Screen sharing
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Peer-to-peer screen sharing â€¢ No account required â€¢ Supports Mac, Windows, and Linux â€¢ Uses stun, turn, and signaling servers for initial connection
ðŸ“– Summary: Bananas Screen Sharing is a peer-to-peer screen sharing application for Mac, Windows, and Linux. It does not require an account and uses stun, turn, and signaling servers only for initial connection establishment. Users can download releases from GitHub or install via Homebrew on macOS.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ StableAnimator | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: High-quality, identity-preserving human image animation
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ End-to-end identity-preserving video diffusion framework â€¢ Synthesizes high-quality videos without post-processing â€¢ Conditioned on a reference image and pose sequence â€¢ Uses image and face embeddings with off-the-shelf extractors â€¢ Global content-aware Face Encoder refines face embeddings
ðŸ“– Summary: StableAnimator is a novel framework for generating high-fidelity human image animations while preserving identity. It uses a video diffusion model with several key modules to ensure ID consistency, including a Face Encoder and ID Adapter. The model also incorporates HJB equation-based optimization for enhanced face quality during inference.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
